value: Frame with Two Scrolls of Leaves, Troisième Livre de Cadres (Third Book of Frames)

label: Description
value: Upright frame design for a mirror or painting, circular form, topped by two scrolls of leaves. Weaponhs at lower left and right, vegetal decoration throughout.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Cartouche with Female Bust, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for an upright symmetrical cartouche in Rococo style, the frame topped by a shell form and surrounded by tree branches and vegetation. Within cartouche, a garden scene with putti figures surrounding a sculpture of a female bust; architectural ruin with columns partially visible in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Putti Mounting a Tent, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for an upright symmetrical cartouche, topped by a dragon; armorial trophies at upper right and left, vegetal decoration throughout, and a mascaron at lower center. Within the frame, a scene of putti figures setting up a tent or structure by draping fabric over tree branches. One putto sits on a drum and holds a banner.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Putti in Landscape, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche, topped by a winged mask and fantasy crown, scrollwork at left and right sides. Within the frame, a landscape scene depicting two putti figures holding staffs or long weapons, sheltered behind a rock. Mountains and a town or village in the background at left.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Bridge in Landscape, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche, an urn filled with flowers at top, cornucopia at upper left and right. Within the frame, a landscape scene depicting a bridge and other small buildings. In the background, craggy mountains.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Two Putti and a Mermaid, Livre de Cartouches à divers usages (Book of Cartouches for Different Uses)

label: Description
value: Blank cartouche in Rococo style framed with two putti and battle weapons at top. Vegetation and plants at sides. A mermaid at lower left holds a triton. Seascape in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with River Goddess, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche surrounded by scrollwork and vegetation. Within the frame, a female figure of a river goddess sitting upon a shell fountain, with putti figures at left and right.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with River Landscape, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche topped with urn full of flowers and surrounded by vegetal decoration. Within the frame, a riverscape scene with a boat upon the water. Shoreline at left and right with architectural buildings partially in view and in the distance.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Vase and Dolphins, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche, armorial trophies at either side and a mask at lower center. Within the frame, a vase topped by two dolphins, water pouring from their nostrils.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cartouche with Armorial Trophy, Livre d’ornements (Book of Ornaments)

label: Description
value: Design for upright symmetrical cartouche, topped with a mask and surrounded by ornamental scrollwork. Within the frame, an elaborate armorial trophy featuring a suit of armor, drums, trumpet, a shield, and banners.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
